meanings.definition: A person who is of equal rank, status, or ability.
meanings.sent1: My compeer at work always helps me when I need it.
meanings.sent2: She considered him her compeer in the field of science.
meanings.sent3: At the chess tournament, my compeer made a move that surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: In the world of art, she was a compeer to the famous painter.
meanings.sent5: Having a compeer in the same industry can be motivating and inspiring.

meanings.definition: To be equal to in quality or ability.
meanings.sent1: I strive to compeer my colleague's dedication to the project.
meanings.sent2: He managed to compeer his opponent's speed in the race.
meanings.sent3: The two chefs compeered in a friendly cook-off competition.
meanings.sent4: She compeered with grace under pressure during the performance.
meanings.sent5: It's challenging to compeer with someone who has years of experience.
